newsitem.title: SPAIN: Endesa will decide on new buys after share.
newsitem.headline: Endesa will decide on new buys after share.

text.p: Spanish electrical firm Endesa said on Monday any decision on whether to purchase the totality of its majority-owned units Enher, Viesgo, Erz, Gesa would be made after its own privatisation, expected in the third quarter this year.

"(Endesa) will not take any decisions for any of them before the next public offer of Endesa shares, which (state holding company) SEPI intends to launch. These decisions will depend on market conditions," a statement said.
Spanish financial daily Cinco Dias said on Monday Endesa had plans to bid for outstanding stakes in the group for up to 120 billion pesetas.
